title: Aluminum fell to 2,794 USD/T on November 18, 2025
summary: Aluminum prices declined 0.77% to 2,794 USD/T on November 18, 2025, though the commodity has risen 0.73% over the past month and 5.55% compared to the same time last year. The price represents the lowest level since October 2025, with aluminum futures in the UK having recently approached a three-year high of $2,915 on November 3rd.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices have reached approximately $2,800 per tonne, driven by surging demand from electric vehicles, solar energy, and grid upgrades. Supply constraints from China's power shortages, new environmental regulations, and unrest in Guinea—which supplies over 45% of China's bauxite imports—have contributed to the rally, with London Metal Exchange inventories falling to their lowest point since 2021.

title: SMM: Secondary Aluminum Ingot Social Inventory Dips on Nov 19
summary: Secondary aluminum ingot social inventory has declined, with prices expected to drop back slightly before fluctuating at elevated levels. The report indicates ongoing market volatility in aluminum trading.

title: Rusal Plans Major Aluminum Smelter Investment in Ethiopia
summary: Ethiopia and Russia’s Rusal signed a memorandum of understanding to build a 500,000-ton annual aluminum smelter, requiring about $1 billion in initial investment. The project could significantly boost Africa’s aluminum production capacity and is expected to be developed over three to four years.

title: Russia's Aluminium Giant Rusal Shuts Key Plant as China's Low-Cost Silicon Undercuts Industry
summary: Rusal is shutting down its Kremniy silicon factory in Russia due to collapsing demand and competition from cheaper Chinese imports. The closure is part of a broader trend of production cuts across Russian heavy industry.

title: Chuangxin Industries IPO Gains Strong Investor Interest as Subscription Opens
summary: Chuangxin Industries, a major Chinese alumina and aluminum producer, is expanding with a planned 500 kt aluminum smelter in Saudi Arabia. The company is known for its cost efficiency and green transition initiatives, positioning itself for global growth.

title: Rusal Ethiopia Aluminium Smelter: $1B African Project
summary: The Rusal Ethiopia aluminum smelter project is set to reshape African manufacturing, adding 500,000 tons of annual capacity and leveraging hydropower for sustainable production. The project could make Ethiopia the continent’s largest aluminum producer if other facilities face closures.

title: $42M Manufacturing Facility Keeps Coast Aluminum — and Its Workers Rooted in Fresno
summary: Coast Aluminum is breaking ground on a $42 million manufacturing and distribution facility in Fresno, California, securing its workforce and future growth in the region. The new facility will open in 2026.

title: Rio Tinto to Cut Yarwun Alumina Output to Buy Time on Waste Plans
summary: Rio Tinto is reducing production at its Yarwun alumina refinery in Australia by 40% to allow more time to develop new waste management solutions. The move reflects ongoing environmental and operational challenges in the sector.

title: SMM: Secondary Aluminum Ingot Social Inventory Dips on Nov 19
summary: Social inventory of secondary aluminum ingots declined on November 19, 2025, as aluminum foil production is expected to pull back due to high end-use inventory. The trend reflects ongoing market adjustments in aluminum supply and demand.

title: Inert Anode Aluminum Production: Carbon-Free Future
summary: Inert anode aluminum production technology can eliminate 95% of CO2 emissions while boosting manufacturing efficiency. If the technology achieves 50% market penetration by 2040, it could eliminate 400-500 million tonnes of direct process emissions globally. The technology also offers premium pricing potential, productivity enhancements up to 5%, and enhanced aluminum purity standards for specialized applications.

title: Across the Aluminum Value Chain: How Collaboration Drives Decarbonization
summary: ELYSIS, a joint venture between Alcoa and Rio Tinto, has successfully started up its 450 kiloampere inert anode cell at Rio Tinto's smelter in Alma, Quebec, marking the first commercial-size implementation of this technology. The metal produced has approximately 40% lower carbon footprint than conventional low-carbon primary aluminum, and when combined with 50% post-consumer recycled content, creates a significantly lower-carbon packaging solution.

title: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever Pioneer Carbon-Free Aluminum in Packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball Corporation, and Unilever have unveiled the world's first consumer personal and home care packaging using ELYSIS carbon-free aluminum in aerosol cans made from 50% ELYSIS primary aluminum and 50% post-consumer recycled content. This collaborative project demonstrates how companies across the value chain can accelerate low-carbon innovation and was announced ahead of the COP30 global climate summit.

title: Ball, Unilever show green aluminium can work
summary: Ball and Unilever are using aluminum produced with Alcoa's ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology in aerosol cans, combining higher recycled content with low-carbon primary aluminum. The ELYSIS process eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions from smelting by using inert anode technology that produces oxygen instead of CO2, with industrial-scale deployment underway in Quebec, Canada.

title: Investing In Innovation: GBCCA Showcases New Technology To Close the Recycling Loop for Aluminium Cans
summary: The Global Beverage Can Circularity Alliance (GBCCA) is showcasing breakthrough innovations including robotics, AI, and next-generation home recycling systems to achieve 100% recycling of aluminium beverage cans by 2050, with an interim goal of 80% by 2030. Advanced technologies are designed to autonomously sort and recover aluminium cans from municipal waste, unlocking immense volumes of valuable material that would otherwise be lost.

title: Steel Rebounds to Highest in November
summary: Steel rebar futures in China rose to CNY 3,050 per tonne, the highest since early November, driven by Beijing's anti-involution policy reducing supply. Crude steel output in China fell 12% year-on-year in October, marking the lowest output since 2021, while steel exports declined 12.5% due to protectionist policies in Southeast Asia and Latin America.

title: Steel Prices in November 2025: Market Dynamics, Price Drivers, and Industry Outlook
summary: US steel prices have surged in November 2025, with hot rolled coil (HRC) prices reaching $910 per ton. Industry insiders attribute this rally to consecutive mill price hikes and extended lead times amid a manufacturing slowdown.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices in China reached 3,090 CNY per tonne on November 18, 2025, a slight increase of 0.16% from the previous day and the highest since early November. Despite a 2.05% rise over the past month, prices remain 7.46% lower than a year ago, reflecting ongoing supply constraints and demand fluctuations.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Hot Rolled Coil (HRC) steel prices rose slightly to 856 USD per ton on November 18, 2025, marking a 5.42% increase over the past month and a 24.78% rise compared to the previous year. However, prices recently hit a 31-week low earlier in November, indicating volatility in the market.

title: Latest Update in the SMM Finished Steel Market
summary: Steel mills have lowered listed prices, leading to weak stainless steel spot prices and bottoming-out patterns in stainless steel futures. The US Fed's hawkish remarks have pressured prices further, with mills lowering prices to boost sales amid cautious procurement by traders.

title: Canadian steel companies announce price increases
summary: Canadian steelmakers Stelco and ArcelorMittal raised prices by C$100 per short ton in early November amid concerns over the Canadian steel industry's state. The price hikes follow months of lower Canadian steel pricing compared to the US and ongoing tariff-related market access challenges.

title: Steel prices in the third week of November 2025
summary: The global steel market showed mixed price movements in the third week of November 2025, with slight increases in some raw materials amid varying regional demand and supply conditions.

title: US raw steel production is down 0.7 percent - week 47, 2025
summary: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending November 15, 2025, was 1.745 million net tons, down 0.7 percent from the previous week. The capacity utilization rate was 76.2 percent, compared to 76.7 percent the prior week. Year-on-year, production is up 8.3 percent.

title: Extreme Steel Inc. Announces Strategic Recapitalization to Accelerate Growth and Expansion in Structural Steel Industry
summary: Extreme Steel Inc. has announced a strategic recapitalization aimed at accelerating growth and expansion in the structural steel sector. The move is expected to enhance the company's production capabilities and market presence.

title: Mantel Develops New Take on Carbon Capture
summary: Mantel, founded by MIT alumni, has developed a carbon capture system that can be added to factories and power plants producing cement, steel, paper, and other materials, reducing carbon emissions by around 95 percent. The system captures CO2 and converts it into pure CO2 that can be transported or stored, while also generating steam as a useful revenue stream. Mantel is currently in conversations with close to 100 industrial partners worldwide, including steel plant owners.

title: Stainless Steel World Sustainability Day 2025
summary: The Stainless Steel World Sustainability Day 2025 brings together visionaries, engineers and decision-makers to address sustainability challenges in the stainless steel industry. The event focuses on decarbonizing production, developing low-impact alloys, and embracing circular design while navigating geopolitical strategies and global supply chain pressures.

title: Copper extends loss as dollar strengthens
summary: Copper prices extended losses as the strengthening U.S. dollar weighed on commodity markets. The decline reflects broader market pressures and investor sentiment tied to currency movements.

title: Copper inches up as investors weigh US job data, Fed rate decision
summary: Copper prices edged higher after a three-day decline, as investors monitored delayed U.S. job data and awaited the Federal Reserve's rate decision. Market movements were cautious amid uncertainty about economic indicators and monetary policy.

title: During the day buyers' purchase willingness significantly increased, market transactions recovered and premiums rose [SMM Yangshan Spot Copper]
summary: Buyer demand for copper increased during the day, leading to a recovery in market transactions and higher premiums. Warrant prices rose slightly, reflecting improved market sentiment.

title: FireFly boosts Green Bay's resources
summary: FireFly Metals has increased the resource estimate for its Green Bay Copper-Gold Project in Newfoundland, Canada, to 50.4 million tonnes at 2% for 1 million tonnes copper-equivalent. The project now features a high-grade core and remains open for further expansion, with underground drilling continuing into 2026.

title: Copper inches up as investors weigh US job data, Fed rate decision
summary: Copper prices edged up as investors assessed US job data and the Federal Reserve's rate decision. Freeport expects its 2026 copper and gold output to be roughly in line with 2025 levels.

title: After deadly accident, Freeport aims to restart Grasberg copper production by July 2025
summary: Freeport-McMoRan plans to restore production at Indonesia's Grasberg copper and gold mine by July 2025 following a fatal incident. The restart will bring large-scale copper production back online.

title: Freeport Provides Update on Restart Plans for Grasberg Minerals District
summary: Freeport announced plans to restore large-scale production from PT Freeport Indonesia's Grasberg operations in Indonesia. The restart is expected to significantly increase copper output in the coming year.

title: The Future of Copper Mining in 2025: Key Trends
summary: This article discusses innovations in copper mining technologies including AI-driven recovery, hydrometallurgical processes, and automated waste sorting that enhance recycling and sustainability. It highlights copper's role in renewable energy infrastructure and the circular economy, emphasizing 100% recyclability and urban mining as key to reducing environmental impact.

title: Sustainable and efficient operations for copper miners
summary: EY reports on copper miners adopting renewable energy and digital technologies to improve sustainability and operational efficiency. Examples include Teck's 100% renewable energy agreement for a Chilean mine and Anglo American's digital twin technology to optimize mining processes, alongside innovations in leaching and tailings management to reduce environmental impact.

title: Copper and the Future: Can New Demand Drivers Replace the Old?
summary: At the World Copper Conference 2025, experts emphasized copper's expanding role driven by traditional uses, green energy, and digitalization. The article highlights copper's critical importance in renewable energy infrastructure, smart grids, and technology, reinforcing its position as a foundational metal for the future global economy.

title: The Future Is Copper: Insights into the Metal's Pivotal Role in Global Growth and Sustainability
summary: This article underscores copper's essential role in the green transition and global economic growth, noting China's significant investments in clean energy that drive copper demand. It positions copper not just as a commodity but as a catalyst for technological progress and sustainability, outperforming other transition metals in resilience and demand.

title: The Copper Initiative
summary: The Copper Initiative by CSIS focuses on securing copper supply chains critical for national security, economic competitiveness, and energy resilience. It highlights the need for policy solutions addressing permitting, strategic partnerships, production incentives, and exploration to meet rising copper demand driven by technology and energy needs.

title: MIT researchers use CT scans to unravel mysteries of early metal production
summary: MIT researchers have adapted medical X-ray CT scanning technology to study ancient copper smelting slag, providing new insights into early metal production processes. This innovative application of imaging technology advances understanding of historical copper metallurgy and its development.

title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in November (Period I)
summary: The Indonesia Nickel Miners Association (APNI) announced the benchmark prices for nickel ore for the first half of November 2025, with the reference price set at $15,075.33/wmt, a 0.44% decrease from October. Prices for various nickel grades also saw slight declines compared to the previous period.

title: On November 19, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was 115,400-119,800 yuan/mt
summary: The SMM #1 refined nickel price on November 19 was reported at 115,400-119,800 yuan/mt, averaging 117,600 yuan/mt, an increase of 650 yuan/mt from the previous day. This reflects a modest upward movement in the refined nickel market.

title: Nickel Prices: Demand Woes Plague Stainless Market
summary: Nickel prices and the stainless steel market faced continued demand challenges in November, with the Stainless MMI sliding 0.54% from October. The market remains oversupplied, and prices are fragile due to high LME inventory levels.

title: LME Nickel Official Prices
summary: The LME nickel official cash price on November 18, 2025, was $14,575–$14,580 per metric ton. The market remains stable, reflecting ongoing trends of oversupply and moderate demand.

title: Indonesia's 120M Ton Cut and Its Ripple on Carbon Markets
summary: Indonesia has reduced its national nickel mining quota by 120 million tons for 2025, cutting permitted production from 272 million tons in 2024 to 150 million tons. This reduction, aimed at preserving resources and promoting sustainable processing, is expected to tighten global nickel supply by about 35%, impacting global supply chains and nickel pricing.

title: Supply-Demand Dynamics & Price Outlook for Nickel Sulphate
summary: Refined nickel producers are switching to nickel sulphate production amid shifting supply-demand dynamics. While nickel sulphate production is ramping up, overall downstream demand is not expected to grow significantly in November and December. Nickel salt prices are forecasted to face downward pressure due to easing supply and steady demand.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Nickel prices reached $14,648.75 per tonne on November 19, 2025, showing a slight increase from the previous day but down 7.74% year-over-year. The market remains oversupplied due to expanded Indonesian production capacity despite recent quota cuts. Stockpiles at LME warehouses have increased, reflecting ongoing supply surplus amid mixed demand from stainless steel and electric vehicle sectors.

title: PE eyes BHP's Nickel West as China tightens rare earth grip
summary: Private equity firms are showing interest in BHP's Nickel West amid China's tightening control over rare earths and nickel supply chains. Nickel prices have halved over three years due to Indonesian low-cost production. Strategic moves by Japanese companies and investors aim to diversify nickel supply outside Chinese influence, with projects in Australia expected to produce competitive nickel volumes.

title: Indonesia limits new nickel permits to add value to production
summary: Indonesia has stopped approving new permits for nickel plants producing certain intermediate products without further processing plans, aiming to push the industry up the value chain. This policy is expected to reduce oversupply and encourage investment in downstream processing, potentially causing project delays or cancellations. The move aligns with Indonesia's 2020 ban on raw nickel ore exports to boost domestic processing.

title: First Atlantic Nickel Attends Benchmark Week 2025 Conference, Highlighting Awaruite – A Naturally Magnetic Nickel-Cobalt Alloy as a Smelter-Free Source For North America's Critical Mi
summary: First Atlantic Nickel presented at Benchmark Week 2025 Conference, showcasing Awaruite, a naturally magnetic nickel-cobalt alloy that offers a smelter-free alternative for North America's critical mineral supply chain. This innovation represents a sustainable approach to nickel extraction and processing without traditional smelting infrastructure.

title: Nornickel upgrades catalyst in Sulphur program
summary: Nornickel has begun replacing the vanadium catalyst in the contact apparatuses at the Sulphur Program at the Nadezhda Smelter. This upgrade represents an operational improvement in the company's nickel processing infrastructure.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started the pilot phase of its green hydrogen production project at its plant in Aosta, Italy. The project uses a 1.008 MW Anion Exchange Membrane electrolyzer to produce 165 tons of green hydrogen annually, aiming to reduce carbon emissions by powering one of its 70 furnaces entirely. This initiative is supported by €7.9 million funding from Italy’s National Recovery and Resilience Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne finalizes Mannesmann tubes acquisition to expand stainless footprint
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has completed the acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes from Salzgitter AG for €135 million, expanding its presence in the seamless tubes and stainless steel nickel alloy pipes market. The acquisition aligns with Cogne's strategy to enhance competitiveness and global reach, especially in aerospace, automotive, and energy sectors.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai approves EUR 45 million capital increase for global expansion
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali approved a €45 million capital increase to support its acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Pipes and to strengthen its global expansion. The investment will enhance competitiveness in aerospace, nuclear, medical, and energy sectors and includes modernization of its Aosta production facility. The company is also expanding its market presence in Europe, Asia, and the US.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali SpA Announces Its Commitment to Sustainability with ResponsibleSteel™ Certification
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has embarked on the ResponsibleSteel™ certification process to formalize its commitment to sustainability, environmental protection, and social responsibility. The company aims to lead the steel industry transformation by integrating sustainable practices into its production processes at the Aosta site.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Tenaris posts surprise 2% rise in sales on stable US, Canada drilling
summary: Tenaris, an Italian steel pipe maker, reported a 2% increase in third-quarter net sales to $2.98 billion, driven by stable drilling activity in the US and Canada. Despite this growth, the company warned that margins would be impacted by the full effect of tariff costs, with weaker sales in Europe and Argentina. Earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization rose 9% to $753 million.

title: Tenaris Launches $600M Second Tranche Under $1.2B Buyback
summary: Tenaris commenced the second tranche of its $1.2 billion share buyback program, with $600 million allocated for repurchases between November 3, 2025, and April 30, 2026. Shares bought under this program will be cancelled. The buyback is authorized by shareholders and complies with EU market abuse regulations.

title: Tenaris S.A. Reports Shareholder Update on Ownership Stake and Planned Share Sales
summary: Tenaris's controlling shareholders plan to sell shares while maintaining at least a 67% ownership stake, reflecting confidence in the company's stock. The board authorized share sales depending on market conditions but intends to keep a significant long-term investment. This update follows the company's ongoing share repurchase program.

title: TENARIS SA Current Report (Foreign Issuer) | TS SEC Filing
summary: Tenaris reported repurchasing 5,445 ordinary shares between November 10 and 14, 2025, as part of the second tranche of its $1.2 billion share buyback program. The total consideration for these shares was approximately €96,639 (USD 112,053). The buyback program aims to repurchase up to $600 million in this tranche.

title: Prysmian shares rise as Italian cable maker seen as winner amid US copper tariffs
summary: Prysmian's shares rose 3.9% after President Trump announced a 50% tariff on imported copper. The Italian cable maker is positioned as a relative tariff winner due to its vertically integrated U.S. operations, sourcing copper from a Freeport mine in Arizona and operating its own copper rod mill in Texas rather than relying on external suppliers.

title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
summary: Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance after posting third-quarter revenue of €5.03 billion, 3% above consensus. The company's Renewable Transmission segment posted 39% organic growth and Power Grids grew 15% organically, with strong performance in North America driving results.

title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
summary: Prysmian, the world's largest copper cable maker, views Trump's 50% copper tariff as beneficial for the American supply chain. The company benefits from its vertical integration and domestic copper sourcing from Freeport-McMoRan, positioning it competitively against smaller competitors.
